description:
I'm going through the openstack.org install for CentOS7

I ran >: nova image-list

and got an error asking me to report it.  I should have been given the list of images available.

rpm -qa|grep nova

openstack-nova-common-12.0.1-1.el7.noarch
openstack-nova-api-12.0.1-1.el7.noarch
python-novaclient-2.30.1-1.el7.noarch

openstack-nova-cert-12.0.1-1.el7.noarch

openstack-nova-conductor-12.0.1-1.el7.noarch
openstack-nova-console-12.0.1-1.el7.noarch

title: Nova API error when getting image list

comments.content: Thanks for taking the time to file a bug! That message can be a little misleading, unfortunately. Try troubelshooting your setup through #openstack or the mailing list first. If you discover more information that indicates this is a bug and not a configuration issue, then feel free to update this issue.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~auggy

comments.content:
Sorry about that, I didn’t mean to waste your time.  I’ll continue to troubleshoot the configuration and see.

Thanks
Drew


> On Feb 5, 2016, at 11:38 AM, Augustina Ragwitz <email address hidden> wrote:
> 
> Thanks for taking the time to file a bug! That message can be a little
> misleading, unfortunately. Try troubelshooting your setup through
> #openstack or the mailing list first. If you discover more information
> that indicates this is a bug and not a configuration issue, then feel
> free to update this issue.
> 
> ** Changed in: nova
>       Status: New => Invalid
